messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] circumcision
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/29/03 7:45:53 AM, genant2@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/29/03 7:45:53 AM, genant2@... writes:

<< I was thinking the Mom was saying that the doctor, if the boy's foreskin
wasn't retractable, might suggest helping it along, as in forcing it to
retract
(ouch), not that the doc might suggest a circumcision. >>

The site has information on how intact penises work (which many circumcised
doctors really don't know) and about the LACK of need for (and problems with)
"retraction."

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] circumcision
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/28/03 9:48:31 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... I was thinking the Mom was saying that the doctor, if the boy s foreskin wasn t retractable,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/28/03 9:48:31 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
ncfarms@... writes:

> May I respectfully suggest the website link below for information on intact
> boys (the preferred description for boys who are not circumcized).
>
>

I was thinking the Mom was saying that the doctor, if the boy's foreskin
wasn't retractable, might suggest helping it along, as in forcing it to retract
(ouch), not that the doc might suggest a circumcision.
Pam G.
